review: We bought this so we could watch ESPN3 on our big TV. It works for that, but isn't great.For one, it has to be plugged in --- either to a USB port (on your TV) or into an outlet. We found that, in order to get good uninterrupted signal, we really needed it plugged into an outlet. That may be troublesome for some people who won't want a cord running from this device (plugged into the TV) to a wall outlet. We were able to run it behind the TV and avoid the cord being visible.We are still learning what else this can do. Will update as we use it more.
author: Rebecca G.

review: This is the worst product on the market, you cannot use it like a Blu-ray player or TV with embedded apps. I spent over an hour trying to get it to work even with the chrome browser it forced me to install on my windows system and every time I tried to play something it would hang up and not show the video on the chromecast. I ended up returning this product because of the lack of support from google, I hope the new Amazon Fire TV unit is way better, the amazon one looks to have app embedded so you don't need another device just to use it. I was using this for someone that does not have a tablet or smartphone, what is the point of this chromecast...
